verses.kjv: And Moses went and spake these words unto all Israel.
verses.ct: Moses went out and spoke these words to all of Israel.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, I am an hundred and twenty years old this day; I can no more go out and come in: also the LORD hath said unto me, Thou shalt not go over this Jordan.
verses.ct: He told them, "I am now 120 years old. I can no longer lead you in and out of battle. Besides, the LORD has told me, 'You will not cross this Jordan River.'

verses.kjv: The LORD thy God, he will go over before thee, and he will destroy these nations from before thee, and thou shalt possess them: and Joshua, he shall go over before thee, as the LORD hath said.
verses.ct: The LORD your God himself will cross over ahead of you. He will wipe out these nations in front of you, and you will take over their land. Joshua will cross over ahead of you, just as the LORD has promised.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall do unto them as he did to Sihon and to Og, kings of the Amorites, and unto the land of them, whom he destroyed.
verses.ct: The LORD will do to them exactly what he did to Sihon and Og, the Amorite kings, and to their territory — he destroyed them completely.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall give them up before your face, that ye may do unto them according unto all the commandments which I have commanded you.
verses.ct: The LORD will hand them over to you, and you must deal with them exactly according to every instruction I have given you.

verses.kjv: Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them: for the LORD thy God, he it is that doth go with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
verses.ct: Be strong and courageous. Don't be terrified or intimidated by them, because the LORD your God is the one who goes with you. He will never let you down or abandon you."

verses.kjv: And Moses called unto Joshua, and said unto him in the sight of all Israel, Be strong and of a good courage: for thou must go with this people unto the land which the LORD hath sworn unto their fathers to give them; and thou shalt cause them to inherit it.
verses.ct: Then Moses summoned Joshua and said to him in front of all Israel, "Be strong and courageous, because you are the one who will go with this people into the land that the LORD promised their ancestors he would give them. You will lead them to take possession of it.

verses.kjv: And the LORD, he it is that doth go before thee; he will be with thee, he will not fail thee, neither forsake thee: fear not, neither be dismayed.
verses.ct: The LORD himself goes ahead of you. He will be with you. He will never let you down or abandon you. Don't be afraid, and don't lose heart."

verses.kjv: And Moses wrote this law, and delivered it unto the priests the sons of Levi, which bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and unto all the elders of Israel.
verses.ct: Moses wrote down this law and gave it to the priests, the descendants of Levi, who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and to all the elders of Israel.

verses.kjv: And Moses commanded them, saying, At the end of every seven years, in the solemnity of the year of release, in the feast of tabernacles,
verses.ct: Moses gave them this instruction: "At the end of every 7 years, during the scheduled year of debt cancellation, at the Festival of Shelters,

verses.kjv: When all Israel is come to appear before the LORD thy God in the place which he shall choose, thou shalt read this law before all Israel in their hearing.
verses.ct: when all of Israel comes to appear in the LORD your God's presence at the place he chooses, you must read this law out loud so all of Israel can hear it.

verses.kjv: Gather the people together, men, and women, and children, and thy stranger that is within thy gates, that they may hear, and that they may learn, and fear the LORD your God, and observe to do all the words of this law:
verses.ct: Assemble the people — men, women, children, and the foreigners living in your towns — so they can listen, learn, and become wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD your God, carefully following every word of this law.

verses.kjv: And that their children, which have not known any thing, may hear, and learn to fear the LORD your God, as long as ye live in the land whither ye go over Jordan to possess it.
verses.ct: Their children, who don't yet know these things, will also hear it and learn to be wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD your God for as long as you live in the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Behold, thy days approach that thou must die: call Joshua, and present yourselves in the tabernacle of the congregation, that I may give him a charge. And Moses and Joshua went, and presented themselves in the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Look, the time of your death is near. Summon Joshua, and both of you come stand in the tent of meeting so I can commission him." So Moses and Joshua went and stood in the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: And the LORD appeared in the tabernacle in a pillar of a cloud: and the pillar of the cloud stood over the door of the tabernacle.
verses.ct: The LORD appeared at the tent in a pillar of cloud, and the pillar of cloud stood above the entrance of the tent.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Behold, thou shalt sleep with thy fathers; and this people will rise up, and go a whoring after the gods of the strangers of the land, whither they go to be among them, and will forsake me, and break my covenant which I have made with them.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "You are about to die and join your ancestors. After that, this people will get up and chase after the foreign gods of the land they are entering. They will abandon me and break the covenant I made with them.

verses.kjv: Then my anger shall be kindled against them in that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide my face from them, and they shall be devoured, and many evils and troubles shall befall them; so that they will say in that day, Are not these evils come upon us, because our God is not among us?
verses.ct: On that day my anger will burn against them. I will abandon them and withdraw my favor from them. They will be consumed, and disaster after disaster will strike them. Then they will say, 'Isn't all this happening to us because our God is no longer with us?'

verses.kjv: And I will surely hide my face in that day for all the evils which they shall have wrought, in that they are turned unto other gods.
verses.ct: And I will certainly withdraw my favor on that day because of all the evil they have done by turning to other gods.

verses.kjv: Now therefore write ye this song for you, and teach it the children of Israel: put it in their mouths, that this song may be a witness for me against the children of Israel.
verses.ct: So now, write down this song for yourselves and teach it to the Israelites. Have them memorize it, so that this song will serve as my witness against the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: For when I shall have brought them into the land which I sware unto their fathers, that floweth with milk and honey; and they shall have eaten and filled themselves, and waxen fat; then will they turn unto other gods, and serve them, and provoke me, and break my covenant.
verses.ct: When I bring them into the land I promised their ancestors — a land flowing with milk and honey — and they eat their fill and grow prosperous, they will turn to other gods and worship them, treating me with contempt and breaking my covenant.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when many evils and troubles are befallen them, that this song shall testify against them as a witness; for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their seed: for I know their imagination which they go about, even now, before I have brought them into the land which I sware.
verses.ct: Then, when many disasters and troubles overwhelm them, this song will testify against them as a witness, because it will never be forgotten by their descendants. I already know the intentions they are forming, even now, before I have brought them into the land I promised."

verses.kjv: Moses therefore wrote this song the same day, and taught it the children of Israel.
verses.ct: So Moses wrote down this song that very day and taught it to the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And he gave Joshua the son of Nun a charge, and said, Be strong and of a good courage: for thou shalt bring the children of Israel into the land which I sware unto them: and I will be with thee.
verses.ct: Then the LORD commissioned Joshua son of Nun and said, "Be strong and courageous, because you will bring the Israelites into the land I promised them, and I will be with you."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Moses had made an end of writing the words of this law in a book, until they were finished,
verses.ct: When Moses had completely finished writing the words of this law in a scroll,

verses.kjv: That Moses commanded the Levites, which bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD, saying,
verses.ct: he gave this command to the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD:

verses.kjv: Take this book of the law, and put it in the side of the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God, that it may be there for a witness against thee.
verses.ct: "Take this book of the law and place it beside the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God, where it will remain as a witness against you.

verses.kjv: For I know thy rebellion, and thy stiff neck: behold, while I am yet alive with you this day, ye have been rebellious against the LORD; and how much more after my death?
verses.ct: I know how rebellious and stubborn you are. Look — while I'm still alive among you today, you have been defiant toward the LORD. How much worse will it be after I'm dead?

verses.kjv: Gather unto me all the elders of your tribes, and your officers, that I may speak these words in their ears, and call heaven and earth to record against them.
verses.ct: Bring together all the elders of your tribes and your officials so I can speak these words directly to them, calling heaven and earth as witnesses against them.

verses.kjv: For I know that after my death ye will utterly corrupt yourselves, and turn aside from the way which I have commanded you; and evil will befall you in the latter days; because ye will do evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger through the work of your hands.
verses.ct: Because I know that after my death you will become completely corrupt and stray from the path I commanded you to follow. Disaster will come upon you in the days ahead because you will do what is evil in the LORD's sight, provoking his anger with the things you make with your hands."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake in the ears of all the congregation of Israel the words of this song, until they were ended.
verses.ct: Then Moses recited the words of this song from beginning to end as the entire assembly of Israel listened.
